Class ClientController

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.client.controller.ClientController
All Implemented Interfaces:
CallableOnClientController, Serializable, Remote
public class ClientController extends UnicastRemoteObject implements CallableOnClientController
Main controller for managing the client in a distributed game application. This class coordinates the interaction between the client model, view, and network communication, handling all operations related to game participation, from nickname registration to game phase management. The class extends UnicastRemoteObject to support RMI communication and implements CallableOnClientController to receive notifications from the game server.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Your development team
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientController

      public ClientController(ClientModel clientModel, ClientPingPongManager clientPingPongManager) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new ClientController with the specified client model and ping-pong manager. Initializes the controller preparing it for handling network operations and model management.
      Parameters:
      clientModel - the client model that maintains the local game state
      clientPingPongManager - the manager for network connection monitoring
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs during remote object initialization

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the execution of the client controller by requesting nickname input. This method represents the main entry point for user interaction, delegating to the view the request for initial credentials.

    • getGames

      public List<GameInfo> getGames()
      Returns a copy of the list of currently observable games. Provides read-only access to available game information to prevent unauthorized modifications to the internal data structure.
      Returns:
      a new list containing the information of observable games

    • getObservableGames

      public List<GameInfo> getObservableGames()
      Returns the direct reference to the observable games list. This method provides direct access to the internal data structure and should be used with caution to avoid unwanted modifications.
      Returns:
      the list of observable games maintained internally

    • getCurrentGameId

      public String getCurrentGameId()
      Returns the identifier of the current game. Provides access to the ID of the game to which the client is currently connected.
      Returns:
      the current game ID, or null if no active game is present

    • getClientModel

      public ClientModel getClientModel()
      Returns the client model associated with this controller. Provides access to the model that maintains the local client state.
      Returns:
      the client model instance

    • register

      public void register(String attemptedNickname)
      Handles the nickname registration process with the DNS server. Attempts to register the specified nickname and starts the ping-pong mechanism for connection monitoring if successful. Displays appropriate error messages if registration fails.
      Parameters:
      attemptedNickname - the nickname to register with the server

    • setDns

      public void setDns(CallableOnDNS dns)
      Sets the DNS service reference for network communication. Establishes the connection to the DNS service that manages game discovery and player registration.
      Parameters:
      dns - the DNS service implementation to use for network operations

    • getDns

      public CallableOnDNS getDns()
      Returns the current DNS service reference. Provides access to the DNS service used for network communication.
      Returns:
      the current DNS service instance

    • getNickname

      public String getNickname()
      Returns the nickname of the current player. Provides access to the registered nickname for this client session.
      Returns:
      the player's nickname, or null if not yet registered

    • handleCreateGameMenu

      public void handleCreateGameMenu(int numPlayers, boolean isTestFlight, PlayerColor chosenColor)
      Handles the creation of a new game based on the specified parameters. Validates the number of players, creates the game using the provided parameters, and updates the game state accordingly. Displays error messages to the user if game creation fails.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - the number of players for the new game; must be between 2 and 4
      isTestFlight - a flag indicating whether the game is in test flight mode
      chosenColor - the color chosen by the player for the game

    • joinGame

      public boolean joinGame(String chosenGameId, PlayerColor chosenColor)
      Attempts to join a selected game with the given game ID and chosen player color. Handles the connection process, updates the game state, and manages error cases. Returns true if the join operation was successful, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      chosenGameId - the identifier of the game to join
      chosenColor - the color chosen by the player for the game
      Returns:
      true if successfully joined the game, false otherwise

    • setView

      public void setView(ClientView view)
      Sets the view component for this controller. Establishes the connection between the controller and the user interface component responsible for displaying game information and collecting user input.
      Parameters:
      view - the view implementation to use for user interaction

    • selectNetworkProtocol

      public CallableOnDNS selectNetworkProtocol(boolean isRmi, String serverAddress, int serverPort)
      Allows the user to select the network protocol for communication. Establishes the network connection using either RMI or Socket protocol based on the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      isRmi - true to use RMI protocol, false to use Socket TCP/IP
      serverAddress - the server address to connect to
      serverPort - the server port to connect to
      Returns:
      the chosen implementation of CallableOnDNS, or null if connection fails

    • leaveGame

      public void leaveGame()
      Leaves the current game and terminates the client application. Handles the disconnection process by notifying the server and performing cleanup operations before exiting the application.

    • pickRandomComponent

      public void pickRandomComponent()
      Requests a random component from the hidden component deck. Initiates the process of picking a random component and displays the appropriate menu for component handling.

    • reserveFocusedComponent

      public void reserveFocusedComponent()
      Attempts to reserve the currently focused component. Validates that the player hasn't exceeded the maximum number of reserved components (2) before sending the reservation request to the server.

    • releaseFocusedComponent

      public void releaseFocusedComponent()
      Releases the currently focused component. Removes the focus from the current component both locally and on the server, returning to the ship board building menu.

      Handles remote exceptions by logging the error and terminating the application. This method provides centralized error handling for network communication failures.
      Parameters:
      e - the IOException that occurred during remote communication

      nickname - the nickname of the player whose ship board to display

    • placeFocusedComponent

      public void placeFocusedComponent(int row, int column)

      Parameters:
      row - the row coordinate for component placement
      column - the column coordinate for component placement

      column - the column coordinate of the component to remove

    • restartHourglass

      public void restartHourglass()
      Restarts the hourglass timer for the current game phase. Checks if the hourglass is already running and validates the request before sending the restart command to the server.

    • pickReservedComponent

      public void pickReservedComponent(int choice)
      Allows the player to select a reserved component based on their choice input. Validates the input, manages reserved components, and informs the server about the selected component to focus on. Displays appropriate views and messages based on the player's actions or errors encountered.
      Parameters:
      choice - the index of the reserved component to pick; must be a valid non-negative integer within the range of available reserved components. Value is decremented internally to match list indexing.

    • handleShipPartSelection

      Parameters:
      choice - the 1-based index of the ship part to select
